summary: This is an FBI communication from the Miami Division to the New York Division, dated September 1-2, 2010, requesting an interview with interior designer Robert Couturier. The document provides context on the closed obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager, and seeks information from Couturier regarding his work for Epstein and observations of potential underage girls.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Previous house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of an obstruction of justice case for attempting to sell lists of additional Epstein victims for $50,000 after being deposed in civil litigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Accused, subject of child prostitution investigation
persons.context: The central figure in the case; pled guilty to state offenses in Florida, served prison time and community supervision as a registered sex offender. His victims filed civil suits against him.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.role: Attorney representing several of Epstein's victims
persons.context: Deposed Alfredo Rodriguez during the civil discovery process. Rodriguez later contacted him about having lists of additional victims.

persons.name: Robert Couturier
persons.role: Interior designer and architect hired by Epstein
persons.context: Hired by Epstein for remodeling and design services at his Virgin Islands residence. Reportedly designed a bedroom with pink furnishings and bunk beds appropriate for teenage girls and observed Epstein with what appeared to be an underage girl.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the previous house manager and butler to Epstein.
Rodriguez was deposed by attorney Edwards and later contacted him about undisclosed victim lists.
Couturier was hired by Epstein for remodeling and design services at his Virgin Islands residence. They may be involved in civil litigation over these services.

events.title: FBI Investigation of Epstein Begins
events.description: Miami Division began investigating Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution.

events.title: Obstruction Case Opened Against Rodriguez
events.description: Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Rodriguez Attempts to Sell Victim Information
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell lists of additional Epstein victims to an undercover employee (UCE) for $50,000.

events.title: Epstein Completes Community Supervision
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein completed his community supervision as a registered sex offender following his state prison sentence.

events.title: FBI Requests Interview with Couturier
events.description: The Miami FBI Division formally requested the New York Division to interview Robert Couturier regarding his work for Epstein and observations of underage girls.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Epstein's former house manager, was charged with obstruction of justice for attempting to sell lists of additional Epstein victims for $50,000 in November 2009.
Interior designer Robert Couturier reportedly designed a bedroom in Epstein's Virgin Islands residence with pink furnishings and bunk beds 'appropriate for teenage girls.'
Couturier reported seeing Epstein in the company of what appeared to be an underage girl, though the location (Virgin Islands or Palm Beach) was unclear.
Epstein and Couturier may have been involved in civil litigation against each other for services rendered at the time of this FBI request.
This document shows the FBI was still actively pursuing leads related to Epstein's activities in September 2010, after he had completed his state sentence.
